channel.title: UK vs USA vs EU PS3 prices
channel.description:
Okay so I just saw on the BBC news website that Sony have reduced the PS3's price and are releasing a slim line version. http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/8207472.stm
According to the BBC the pricing is as follows;
In Europe the price has been lowered to 299 euros, in the US to $299 and in the UK to £249.99.
So if I convert all of these prices into USD
[b]EU[/b] = é299 = [b]$423.53[/b] [b]UK[/b] = £249.99 = [b]$412.61[/b] [b]US[/b] = $299 = [b]$299[/b]
So as you can see the EU and UK version are a good $110-120 more than the US version.
Why should we have to pay that much more? It's outrageous, it's not at all like the hardware will be different.
SUCKS ANUS

item.title: UK vs USA vs EU PS3 prices
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

PS3 games are not region locked.

As for the prices, its like that with everything. The 360 arcade unit in the USA is $199, but is £160 in the UK (now, MS just put the price up). That is £40 more. That isn’t the best example, but its just how it is in the UK, we have a higher cost of living, higher average wage and higher taxes.

And no, it isn’t true they are removing the blu-ray player. THE GAMES ARE ON BLU-RAY, how do you fucking expect people to buy all those old games? Sony know better than to segment their market. Oh and no they didn’t move manufacturing, they just renewed a contract with the same company that they were using all along.

It is cheaper because that is how technology goes, everything gets smaller, more energy efficient and cheaper.

Read full topic
item.source: UK vs USA vs EU PS3 prices

item.title: UK vs USA vs EU PS3 prices
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“the fu superior, post:27, topic:296111”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=392140.msg2939388#msg2939388 date=1251760903]

inb4 ps3hasnoRROD

You should note that the PS3 is getting a price-cut because they moved manufactuing to an unknown country. So now you can expect your PS3 to be built by a 12 year old Asian that prolly likes moparscape. This means that the console is more likey to break down (Pretty similar to silmline ps2), I know many Fat ps2s which outlived the slimline.

The guy presenting it failed because 299 is not the price of the UK one.

i had a ps2 slim edition and it was sturdy as balls
[/quote]
What? I had mine for 4 years until I sold it, and I never had any problems. I even had it modded, and left it on 8+ hours on at a time.[/quote]
same. i actually left mine on for a few days cause i didnt have a memory card and had to wait until i could buy one to save the game

Read full topic

item.title: UK vs USA vs EU PS3 prices
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:21, topic:296111”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=392140.msg2937664#msg2937664 date=1251655810]

They know they can get away with it because it sounds reasonable to us Europeans. It’s not our fault the dollar is shit.

Doesn’t that mean that since we pay less that the dollar is worth more…?

no cuz the dollar ain’t worth the paper it’s on
[/quote]
Evens out with the 100’s and 20s printed etc.[/quote]
probably, but the point is the dollar isnt worth more, its because we have to pay for all the extra tax on there, for example the higher import tax sony would have to pay, the tax that the delivery company has to pay and then the tax that the shop has to pay all gets passed down to the consumer

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

goatee:

It’s not our fault the dollar is shit.

Well, the pound is falling too, I just feel sorry for the Europeans.

[quote=“Davidude, post:4, topic:296111”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=392140.msg2919474#msg2919474 date=1250677988]
Order it off the internet from a US site and get it shipped to the UK, PROFIT ??? Screw paying an extra $110-120 for getting it a bit earlier.
[/quote]
I don’t think I’d be able to play any UK games with it though. Aren’t games like PAL or NTSC only, so you can only use one type in your console?[/quote]

I’m pretty sure PS3 games aren’t regional locked, but it comes with a catch. I can’t quite remember what it is at the moment but if I do I’ll post it here.

sanga282:

davidude its called tax, get over it

Still, the Europeans are paying more.

Would now be a good time to bring up the fact that SCEE is quite frankly terrible compared to SCEA?
